newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Tesco to delist Global but keeps investing.
newsitem.headline: Tesco to delist Global but keeps investing.

text.p: The delisting of Hungarian Global TH Rt from the Budapest Stock Exchange will not affect the expansion plans for the retailer, majority-owned by UK-based Tesco Plc, company officials said.

Tesco, which holds more than 96 percent of food retailer Global via its Netherlands-based subsidiary Cheshunt Overseas Finance BV, on Monday made a buyout offer for Global shareholders at 2,100 forints or 7.48 pounds per share.
The company and Creditanstalt Securities, which helps Tesco in the transaction, told a news conference that the move was aimed at reducing administrative costs.
"One reason to delist was that Global shares have had a very low turnover since their listing," said Zsolt Furedi, corporate finance official at Creditanstalt Securities.
In February Global shares had an average daily turnover of 1.85 million forints, according to figures released in the monthly report of the BSE.
On Monday, following the publication of the buyout offer which runs from March 24 to May 12, 1997, and from January 5 to February 27, 1998, Global shares rose 200 forints to 2,000.
Beyond the delisting, Tesco's investment plans in Hungary remain intact and it will go ahead with plans to open new stores in addition to the 43 it has now.

"We've got very ambitious investment plans," said Global's board member Robin Caley. The construction of five new stores would start this year. Tesco has so far invested some 60 million pounds in Global, Caley said.
In 1996 Global posted an unudited loss of 1.8 billion forints on sales of 11.3 billion, against an after-tax profit of 303 million on sales of 6.84 billion in 1995.
But Caley said Global's finances were in line with Tesco's budget.
"The financial performance of Global, it's in line with our plans," he said.
"We achieved a very strong sales increase during 1996," he said, adding that turnover was expected to quadruple from current levels by around the end of 1998 or early 1999.
